oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE MORPHOLOGICAL RESPONSE OF BEACHES PROTECTED BY DIFFERENT BREAKWATER CONFIGURATIONS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lorenzoni, Carlo
Postacchini, Matteo
Mancinelli, Alessandro
Brocchini, Maurizio
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: coastal defence
rubble-mound breakwaters
maritime physical models
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A series of experimental tests on a 2D movable-bed physical model of the protected sandy beach of Gabicce Mare, on the central Adriatic Sea in Italy, is described. Three emerged and three submerged configurations of rubble-mound detached breakwaters, for beach protection, placed at different positions, were tested in the Ancona (Italy) wave flume and the obtained results were compared with those found for a structure-free configuration. Both wave dissipation and reduction of beach erosion efficiency under various wave conditions were obtained and, in particular, the short-term hydro-morphodynamic response of the different tested breakwater configurations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; sediment.52
